method.name: Selective Nearest Neighbor

reference.ref: G. L. Ritter, H. B. Woodruff, S. R. Lowry, T. L. Isenhour, An algorithm for a selective nearest neighbor decision rule, IEEE Transactions on Information Theory 21:6 (1975) 665-669.

generalDescription.type: Preprocess Method. Data Reduction. Instance Selection. Decremental
generalDescription.objective: Reduce the size of the training set without losing precision or accuracy in order to a posterior classification
generalDescription.howWork: Selective Nearest Neighbor (SNN) extends CNN such that every member of T must be closer to a member of S of the same class than to anoy memeber of T (instead of S) of a different class. Further, the method ensures a minimal subset satisfying theses conditions.

parameterSpec.param: Distance Function: K-NN implements two distance functions. a) Euclidean with normalized attributed and b) HVDM (see paper D.R. Wilson, T.R. Martinez. Reduction Tecniques For Instance-Based Learning Algorithms. Machine Learning 38:3 (2000) 257-286.)
